creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: organic, leaf like form supported by forked twig that becomes portion of the form's body, and tall, narrow point; another smaller twig supporting bottom; black and rich brown lacquer with faint gold pattern
medium: Lacquer, hemp cloth, bamboo, and gold
text: As Muramoto continued to refine his technique for the Wing of Foliage series, he eventually made larger foliage wings, which he detached from the wall in order to produce freestanding lacquer sculptures that express movement, delicacy, and tension. For this large exemplar he won the Yamamura Shin’ichi Award at the 2012 Ishikawa International Urushi Exhibition in Kanazawa. He integrated a bamboo twig over the entire length of this delicate work, the surface of which is partly decorated with a fine gold pattern.
title: Wing of Foliage #10-09
